places_to_visit.name: Angkor Wat
places_to_visit.description: Angkor Wat is a massive temple complex in Cambodia and one of the most important archaeological sites in Southeast Asia. Originally constructed as a Hindu temple, it later became a Buddhist temple. Its extensive bas-reliefs and architecture are celebrated for their grandeur and detail.

places_to_visit.name: Angkor Thom
places_to_visit.description: Angkor Thom is a fortified city and the last capital of the Khmer Empire. Key structures within Angkor Thom include the Bayon Temple with its iconic stone faces, the Baphuon Temple, and the Terrace of the Elephants.

places_to_visit.name: Ta Prohm
places_to_visit.description: Ta Prohm is a temple known for its dramatic ruins overgrown with massive tree roots. It is famous for its appearance in the film 'Tomb Raider' and offers a unique glimpse into how nature and architecture intertwine.
